stimulusHtml: Assume an economy is in long-run equilibrium. If there is an increase in short-run aggregate supply, how will it be demonstrated in the Phillips curve model?
choicesHtml: A movement along the short-run Phillips curve to the left of long-run equilibrium
A movement along the short-run Phillips curve to the right of long-run equilibrium
A shift of the short-run Phillips curve to the left
A shift of the short-run Phillips curve to the right
A shift of the long-run Phillips curve to the right
